title_review: So good went back the next night
review_preview: Minibar is not a particularly enticing name for a restaurant, but the packed tables and line out the door told a different story. This was to be our first experience with tapas and we were truly spoiled right out of the gate. First off, don’t...
review_full: Minibar is not a particularly enticing name for a restaurant, but the packed tables and line out the door told a different story. This was to be our first experience with tapas and we were truly spoiled right out of the gate. First off, don’t expect a small plate of olives, some cured meat and a little cheese, this place is full on creative genius. My favorite plate by far was roasted eggplant wrapped in bacon with tomato orange sauce. It wasn’t bacon, it was just the right amount of some kind of yummy specialty ham draped on the big chunks of succulent eggplant and the sauce on it was a-mazing! All the tapas were as interesting and yummy and you will be sorry you can’t eat more. Make a reservation, chances are pretty good you’ll need it. Service is friendly, helpful and responsive. We overdid it on ordering food, had several drinks before and during the meal and ended up with full bellies and a 50€ bill.

Our favorite was Tapa Breton, grilled goat cheese extraordinaire, accompanied by great service. Cost for a tasty and satisfying dinner sans alcohol: €31.50. BTW our waiter was also the owner: a delightful, friendly man. PS—try the mousse-like dessert with a swirl of carmelized sugar.

title_review: A cool Madrid bar - day and night
review_preview: We stayed across the street in a hotel, so we had the chance to be miniBARs guest on different occasions. It a nice place to just have a coffee in the middle of the day or afternoon. You can also go there and have a...
review_full: We stayed across the street in a hotel, so we had the chance to be miniBARs guest on different occasions. It a nice place to just have a coffee in the middle of the day or afternoon. You can also go there and have a beer or a wine and tapas. Or you go there at night and enjoy a drink and music. The atmosphere is very special. It is a small room with art from different artists. You can also sit outside if you like. What we enjoyed most was the superb friendly miniBAR tender and the people that come here. They make you easily feel at home and you get into contact very fast. As the Opera isn't far away you always have very interesting people. I can only reccomend that you stop by.

review_preview: Maybe we were there on an off night, but the atmosphere/ambiance of this restaurant is lacking. The food was tasty, no complaints, but we were in and out within an hour.  The place has a funky vibe that reminded me of a college hangout, not...
review_full: Maybe we were there on an off night, but the atmosphere/ambiance of this restaurant is lacking. The food was tasty, no complaints, but we were in and out within an hour. The place has a funky vibe that reminded me of a college hangout, not a good restaurant. The service, although indeed friendly, was overbearing. We were asked 3 times within the first 5 minutes if we were ready to order food yet. Every other patron appeared to be under the age of 35 (we are in our early 60's). A few tables had young children, and many appeared to be college students. At first I thought they were moving us along because we didn't fit the profile, but I noticed everyone received fast paced service. If you are looking for some decent food, a quick beverage, and to be on your way, choose this place. If you want a leisurely dinner, with a relaxed atmosphere, go elsewhere.

review_full: Who would have guessed that this cute restaurant with modest decor is probably the best Tapas in Madrid. We came across this place in a restaurant search and was curious because of the high reviews. We are glad that we made an effort to stop by for dinner. The food is excellent. We had the signature grilled goat cheese, second most popular wild boar roll and the chicken cube in spicy cheese sauce. They were all very delicious. We were a bit disappointed that then duck leg confit was sold out. We would have loved to try it. Don't forget to order the sangria as it is really good. Service is excellent and attentive. The server refilled our bread for the grilled goat cheese when she saw that we were running low. Rating:  1 - Poor, 2 - OK, 3 - Good, 4 - Very Good, 5 - Excellent

title_review: Really nice Indian food in the North of Madrid
review_preview: As close as you can get to the real thing in the West and certainly in Madrid. This is a really nice (and incredibly busy!!!) Indian place; prices aren’t cheap, but it is in great mid range. Curries are better than the average stuff you...
review_full: As close as you can get to the real thing in the West and certainly in Madrid. This is a really nice (and incredibly busy!!!) Indian place; prices aren’t cheap, but it is in great mid range. Curries are better than the average stuff you get in Madrid, so if you live around Sanchinarro and are craving for some reasonably prepared Indian, this is a must go. My kids (4 and 8) loved it - and they know what good Indian food is. Service is quick and attentive. On the minus: if food was a little less “westernised” I would find it even better.

With no reservation (on a Monday night) we didn't have to wait for a table. Service was friendly and very helpful in helping us choose our dishes.  You've already ready about the amazing goat cheese and bread appetizer (all true), but we also shared croquettes, a tuna sandwich and smoked salmon salad, which were all excellent. A nice glass of Sangria and a very reasonable bill made this was one of our best meals in Madrid.

Also, the potatoes ( from starters) with the 3 different sauces are extremely delicious. The hamburger -a surprise since it does not have the traditional bread but it consists of 2 beefs and potatoes - is one of the highlights of the Metro Bistro as well as the dish with the pork. We had also a great red wine, the 'Habla del Silencio '. Another surprise the bread- try the dark one with orange and chocolate ! In one word : you have to visit the place more than one time !  p.s. Lucas offered us in the beginning of our dinner, apple mojito . Our dinner just has started like this ...

review_full: A friend found this place online with great reviews so she wanted to give it a try. The service was brilliant from start to finish, we were a little pushed for time so our waiter had our plates brought out as soon as possible. We were treated to two tasting samples of the house special mojito. While it was very good they also had several other cocktails which we ended up getting. The croquettes were probably the best that I have ever had. I had one of the nicest eggs that I ever had and unfortunately, I am still not entirely sure how it was cooked (something similar to poaching but the result being a softer egg without the quaggy texture). This egg was served on a combination of mushroom types with a sauce that complimented the dish while not taking away from the flavour. I then had some guinea fowl which was cooked to perfection on top of eggplant with a mouth-watering coconut sauce. It was probably in my top 5 dining experiences despite having to cut this experience short to make a flamenco show on time. Highly recommended!

title_review: Wonderful, and not just the food
review_preview: We went here on the second to last night before the end of our honeymoon, after ten days of horrible fried, bland, salty, fatty gross food this place was like heaven! The food has flavour! The menu has a good variety of options and it's...
review_full: We went here on the second to last night before the end of our honeymoon, after ten days of horrible fried, bland, salty, fatty gross food this place was like heaven! The food has flavour! The menu has a good variety of options and it's not your standard tapas. We were there about 8pm and it was already packed so get there early - but if you do have to wait then wait, it's worth it! We waited 10 minutes tops and were seated outside, on a lovely Madrid evening. I think that even better than the food was the service. The owner (I am assuming here) was a lovely friendly guy, very willing to help out on choices for good food and compared to the rude service we had experienced the rest of our trip, it was so nice to feel wanted as a customer. Despite the crowds we were never rushed to turn the table and I wish they had one of these in London!

review_preview: We dined at El miniBAR while traveling for business.  The customer service personality was a 10.  The actual customer service was a 5.  Be prepared to wait quite a while to receive your food and drinks from the time that you order them.  They even...
review_full: We dined at El miniBAR while traveling for business. The customer service personality was a 10. The actual customer service was a 5. Be prepared to wait quite a while to receive your food and drinks from the time that you order them. They even forgot one of your meals, so we ended up sharing everything. The food has the inspiration to be amazing, but falls short with average taste. The appearance of the food looks amazing, but I judge on actual taste. This is no where near the top restaurants on Madrid and can only determine it's high ranking by it's mere presence on TripAdvisor. Also, the drinks are unleaded. We ordered a Sangria to start and didn't even have a buzz. Then a Caipirinha, which was a bit more leaded, but no a real drink. So we ended with a white wine that was OK. Overall, I give the experience a 5 and think this is the most overrated restaurant I've been too. Plus is was dirty and dingy inside. Come on TripAdvisor reviewers, we owe future guests the truth and feel this being rated #2 or #4 or even in the top 20 is a total disgrace.

We had a melted cheese dish that I believe had some cinnamon, I know it doesn't sound good, just order it. We had an amazing meat stew but quite lite, it was so good we ordered another. The staff were lovely prices were very readonable and the food was excellent. Very few tourists as well added to the experience.

title_review: Amazing pizza restaurant in the heart of Madrid
review_preview: Found this place on our last night in Madrid.  We were walking on the Gran Via and thought everything would be too expensive, but this place fit the bill perfectly.  We had 6 people and they got us in right away.  The menu was great,...
review_full: Found this place on our last night in Madrid. We were walking on the Gran Via and thought everything would be too expensive, but this place fit the bill perfectly. We had 6 people and they got us in right away. The menu was great, and they also spoke English to help us with our limited Spanish! They had some great specialty pizza, like barbeque chicken, breakfast pizza, etc. My wife got a veggie pizza with gorgonzola, walnuts and honey. Very good quality and flavors. We all tried each other's pizza. You could see the pizza being made right there. Atmosphere was good and hip with a great view of the street. We had a great time, good food and fun way to finish our Madrid trip!

The empanadas were really basic for the most part and nothing so outstanding as is being portrayed on this site. They are good and definitely better than a typical empanada one would have, but I have certainly had better ones with more flavor and spice before. To consider it as one of the top ten places to eat in Madrid (as is shown on here) is a misrepresentation, in my opinion. If you are in a hurry and want a good, fast, and inexpensive meal, then I would definitely recommend to come here. One thing I'll say is that the service I received was excellent which is why I give it 4 stars instead of 3. Very pleasant and helpful young man.

review_preview: After eating in a number of different restaurants, we stopped here for our final meal before our flight home later that evening. We had tried to get a table the night before but with good reason, there were no tables available and we ended up...
review_full: After eating in a number of different restaurants, we stopped here for our final meal before our flight home later that evening. We had tried to get a table the night before but with good reason, there were no tables available and we ended up in for a lunch time service instead.  We were served quickly - a pitcher of Sangria gave the 3 of us 2 glasses each for 15euro and we each ordered two mains each which was more than enough for lunch! We managed to squeeze in deserts (two between us) and were pleasantly full.  We had the pork tacos, ham croquettes, broken egg timbale (incredible and soooo filling), and the bloody rosi burrata. All of which were delicious and served equally as quirky as the restaurant itself.  Very glad we visited!

He was Hospitable, knowledgeable, very very nice and funny. You need a reservation if you want to make sure you get a table.  We were early on Valentines day! And managed to be seated. The place was full really loved the eclectic, vibrant intagramable place! Everything we tried was delicious. We got a variety of tapas, desert and the loca sangria! We tried the tuna tataki, octupus, pork tacos, slow cooked wings, croquettes and a surprise dessert suggested by the waiter and hit a home run with us. If you are in Madrid, make sure you stop here. You won’t regret it.

title_review: A good find excellent cheese tapas
review_preview: We had to wait for a table and sat at the bar to start with. We were given a complimentary goats cheese tapas. Nice.There's an interesting menu with a few different plates. In half and full ration sizes. Prices are good. We opted for...
review_full: We had to wait for a table and sat at the bar to start with. We were given a complimentary goats cheese tapas. Nice. There's an interesting menu with a few different plates. In half and full ration sizes. Prices are good.  We opted for their award winning dish which was grilled goats cheese with tomato and coriander. It was really delicious. We mopped up every bit with the bread.  We also shared the crispy boar rolls with mushroom sauce. Good flavour of meat and it was tasty.  Finally the tuna tartare with mango guacamole. Plenty of tuna quite coarsely chopped. The guacamole was good. Had a nice flavour and smooth.  Stand out dish is the cheese one...a delicious plate.  Beers are nice and cold and the service at the bar and table was very good.  Nicely presented dishes too. Plenty of bread provided.

review_preview: We had our lunch on the first day in Madrid. Colorful, cool and funky place and, yes, at Rosi La Loca know very well their job! We popped it without a reservation but despite the fact it was full full, we got a table at...
review_full: We had our lunch on the first day in Madrid. Colorful, cool and funky place and, yes, at Rosi La Loca know very well their job! We popped it without a reservation but despite the fact it was full full, we got a table at the basement. Staff is as cool as the decor and ambience of the place, very helpful with the menu and very friendly with everybody. We ordered paella with chicken and seafood and we had been informed it needs some extra time to be ready (was also noted on the menu) and we were patient because we wanted so much to have a real Spanish paella. In the meantime, while waiting we had been offered complimentary, yummy potatoes with a sauce. And yes, it was worth waiting because paella was amazingly good. We ate everything and it was a big pan! From what we saw passing in front of our eyes, served on other tables the rest of the dishes looked so delicious and I'm sure they really were, otherwise there wouldn't be so many people (even locals) for lunch already in the early afternoon! Go for it with no hesitation and be patient for a paella! You won't regret it!

We came here because we had a excellent meal at the other Metro Bistro near the Templo de Debod about two years ago and wanted to see if the Plaza Mayor location could match that experience. They did in all respects! We had the restaurant almost to ourselves because we went in the mid-afternoon for an early dinner, so the service was great. Staff were really helpful in both helping us choose off the menu and when we enquired about general things to do in Madrid. It was busy but I felt we got as much service as we would have wanted without being hassled or feeling like we'd been forgotten. I don't know the name of the waitress but she provided this service and even told us about where to go out and get souvenirs.  4 tapas dishes were too much for us! The waitress did enquire thinking we didn't like the food but it was literally too much for us to eat. But i thought it was nice to ask as I've had experiences where I've left a plate of food because it wasn't nice and the waiters have not cared. I therefore thought service deserved a good rating as she was really attentive.  The restaurant is quite small (see photos) but this didn't bother us. This dining was better than the one we had in La Latina the previous evening which cost us double and it had a nice albeit busy atmosphere. Food was not 5* but we didn't want anything fancy. Would recommend if you are okay with small and cheerful but not if you want a fine dining experience.

title_review: Loved this place, especially the "Crazy Cheese"
review_preview: We were staying in the Tryp Ambassador opposite and to be honest may not have given El Minibar a second glance were it not for the TA reviews. So glad we did, In fact we ended up here one way or another every day of...
review_full: We were staying in the Tryp Ambassador opposite and to be honest may not have given El Minibar a second glance were it not for the TA reviews. So glad we did, In fact we ended up here one way or another every day of our stay. The owner, Nacho, is hilarious, charming and welcoming. There was obviously a large local/regular clientele but us foreigners were made to feel perfectly at home and were even remembered on our subsequent visits.  The bar has a short tapas menu of dishes many of which we had not seen elsewhere. Particularly fantastic is the "Queso con costra caliente" - or as Nacho calls it "Crazy Cheese" - which is grilled cheese on a tomato marmalade with cinnamon. Doesn't sound great, in fact it doesn't looks great either but my goodness it tastes divine!

review_preview: I went to the thesaurus for this one. I started off with eccentric and went on from there. The facade is shabby, and that's being kind. There are two tables inside, but the action is outside, yes, on the sloping sidewalk with aluminum chairs and...
review_full: I went to the thesaurus for this one. I started off with eccentric and went on from there. The facade is shabby, and that's being kind. There are two tables inside, but the action is outside, yes, on the sloping sidewalk with aluminum chairs and tables which could have been bught at Ace or Home Depot. Having said that, and if you cant get past the exterior, you can enjoy an unusalyy good meal. We asked the freindly waiter for the house specialty and it was a kind of beef stew, but incredibly good. The meat literally melts in your mouth Then we had two more dishes which could not possibly equal the first dish. The wine list? Three red and three white will give you an idea about what goes on. The red we chose was nice even tasty. They only sell by the glass! The owner, Nacho, makes his way around the tables and is friendly and gracious and absolute fun. If you expect El Club Allard, Botin, or any of the other recommended restaurants, don't go. But if you want a great time with good food and locals walking all around, give this place a try. It was a great experience.

title_review: Degustation menu at a reasonable price!
review_preview: I visited here recenlty with my wife for a nice romantic meal! We had reservations at 8.30pm and we greeted with a nice warm welcome!From what I can tell people in Spain tend to eat out late from 9pm onwards so it was quite busy...
review_full: I visited here recenlty with my wife for a nice romantic meal! We had reservations at 8.30pm and we greeted with a nice warm welcome!From what I can tell people in Spain tend to eat out late from 9pm onwards so it was quite busy by the time we left! Its located just off Plaza Mayor which is a prominent tourist destination so its quite easy to find!  We were treated to a welcoming cocktail type shot to begin with which I think was a mojitio style with celery. Very nice I must say!  We tried the 7 degustation menu and had cocktails to drink. We had been to a cocktail bar previously so decided to stick with them instead of wine.  The meal was excellent, course after course came at an even tempo while it was quick we never felt rushed! It was perfect! The service was excellent and we addressed in English by all the waiter which helped. Some had better English than others but I can't complain after all I am a visiter in their country.  Overall service and food was excellent and the highlight was the chocolate dessert medley, amazing!!! Price was reasonable too for a degustation menu, €38pp and cocktails for around €90. There are many place that do fine dining degustation menus to choose from in Madrid but this is a bargin in comparison!  I would thoroughly recommend going here if in Madrid.

review_preview: Our first night in Madrid and we picked this restaurant, with help from trip advisor of course. We went to dinner a little earlier than expected, maybe 7pm, and had the place to ourselves. The location is nice right along Gran Via. Inside, the restaurant...
review_full: Our first night in Madrid and we picked this restaurant, with help from trip advisor of course. We went to dinner a little earlier than expected, maybe 7pm, and had the place to ourselves.  The location is nice right along Gran Via. Inside, the restaurant has a great look to it and the staff was quick to have us seated and taken care of. English and Spanish menu options.  First of all, drinks are amazing. We sat near the bar so we got to watch our waiter make each one. Order sangria (comes in a little mason jar) and 2 mojitos- strawberry and mango (comes in flower pot). We could've drank 3 rounds of these.  The menu has a great selection, sticks true to its Italian/pizzeria feel. Our waiter was helpful to answer questions and give recommendations. We got a variety of pizza, mozzarella, and pastas. All spectacular. You could really tell they take time with each dish and use the stone oven!  We had to end the nice with dessert; cheesecake and oven baked cookie skillet. WOW. we may go back just for these, we were stuffed from the great meal but we definitely made room for this.  What really finished it perfectly was when our waiter brought us each a shot of an aperitif on the house (can't remember the name of it, but some kind of cinnamon-y milk-alcohol mixture). It was really a nice gesture that we would have never expected.  It's going to be hard to top this; if all else fails we could be back here in a few nights!  I recommend giving it a shot if you love some good Italian food and amazing service. Oh and did I mention the great prices?

title_review: Stick to the burgers - they are great
review_preview: Visited with a work colleague. Fancied a good burger and were tempted in by the nice decor. Menu is primarily burgers and steaks - probably walk by if you are vegetarian! You choose the meat (beef or Ox), size, how cooked, type of bun and...
review_full: Visited with a work colleague. Fancied a good burger and were tempted in by the nice decor. Menu is primarily burgers and steaks - probably walk by if you are vegetarian! You choose the meat (beef or Ox), size, how cooked, type of bun and sides - simple but great. I had the Tijuana while my colleague had a simple steak burger. Both excellent and the jalapeños gave mine a real kick. Good choice of beer and cocktails too. We ordered desserts which were average and wish we had not bothered. But great value. Stick to the meat!

review_preview: My wife and I walked in to this empty restaurant and they asked if we had a reservation ... first time in 2 weeks in Spain this was an issue. The hostess proceeded to find a way to accommodate us amongst the 4 tables of...
review_full: My wife and I walked in to this empty restaurant and they asked if we had a reservation ... first time in 2 weeks in Spain this was an issue. The hostess proceeded to find a way to accommodate us amongst the 4 tables of guests in the vast expanse of their restaurant. We sat for 20 minutes without even being asked about drinks or food. Meanwhile a family of 4 were seated next to us. They ordered and received drinks, bread, a pizza for their children and a salad. Yes we could have yelled a the waitress to take our order while she waited in that family, but that isn’t how service works. We got up and left. Reality is their is a pizza place called Hot Now just a 5 minute walk away that will accommodate you with a smile. You get to sit alone or at a communal table, which is nice to interact with locals. This place was nearly full and they had no issue putting us at the communal table. The guacamole was excellent and the pizza was amazing for less money than this pretentious place. Don’t waste your time here wander 5 minutes into the side streets and get better food for your money. They got one star because I can’t give zero. But this is clearly zero star.

title_review: Totally worth the price, yummy burgers!
review_preview: First day in Madrid, I was starving and planning to visit the Reina Sofia Museum in the evening...This restaurant had excellent reviews so I stopped there.It's quite a dressed-down venue, big pillows and sofa, clean but not the tidiest place...Luckily waiters spoke...
review_full: First day in Madrid, I was starving and planning to visit the Reina Sofia Museum in the evening... This restaurant had excellent reviews so I stopped there. It's quite a dressed-down venue, big pillows and sofa, clean but not the tidiest place... Luckily waiters spoke a good English and advised to go for the popular Ox burger. Despite the slight delay serving it, the meal was great.. Well, the burger was cooked properly and still juicy as it should. Chips were divine! If I have to find something to improve are the prices. A bit high compared to the average and the style of the restaurant... However, I strongly recommend if you are eager to taste a proper burger in Madrid: the chain has other branches in the city!

review_preview: After almost 2 weeks of constant barrage of Spanish food, we were craving for some down-right dirty burger joint, and this one does not disappoint. The menu has many interesting burgers as well as other wonderful dishes such as prime ribs (look seriously good). The...
review_full: After almost 2 weeks of constant barrage of Spanish food, we were craving for some down-right dirty burger joint, and this one does not disappoint. The menu has many interesting burgers as well as other wonderful dishes such as prime ribs (look seriously good).  The burger (I ordered something with Bacon, I think) was really good. The ingredients were fresh and it was one of the better burgers I've had.  The location is very convenient, really close to Atocha metro station (and the train station too). The place is starting to get packed around 9pm though (normal Spanish dining time) so better hurry or make a reservation! The price is also very reasonable, with hamburgers average around 10-12 euros for 250 gram beef (comes with fries and small salad). Definitely great burger for good price.

title_review: It was ok but nothing special
review_preview: We were on the way to another place  but we noticed that this Steakburger was crowded and full of people, so we thought they have to serve a great food as there are so many people. Luckily, we got a table immediately and we didn´t...
review_full: We were on the way to another place but we noticed that this Steakburger was crowded and full of people, so we thought they have to serve a great food as there are so many people. Luckily, we got a table immediately and we didn´t wait a long for our food. Waitress forgot to bring us a dip for a burger and when we tried to explain him that dip is missing he told that we don´t have it in our order. We kindly asked for a menu in order to show it to him but due to lack of English he didn´t understand us. Then meanwhile another waitress was there and we tried to explained it to him but he didn´t get it as well. We started to eat and I found in my burger a black hair...it was of course unpleasant, especially when I showed it to the waitress and she told: wait......In couple minutes came her colleague, said sorry and took the burger away. As soon as they brought new one we also got our souce for burgers. The quality of burgers was ok and as I wrote in a title nothing special. I think next time we go somewhere else and not to that place. It is not because of the hair but just the food was not awesome. As a complimentary and "sorry" we got a desert for free. But to be honest we would prefer to get a burger for a half price or also for free :)

Had the paella for starter, which may have been home made earlier in the day, but had clearly been reheated (poorly, it was lukewarm at best) as it came out within 2 minutes of ordering. The ribs for main were also cold and came only with some potato wedges. It was then we decided to skip the dessert (even though it was included in the €10 menu).  Yes I understand that the price will attract customers, but you can get much tastier food elsewhere for only a few euros extra! Very disappointed and the reviews don't give a true reflection of this restaurant.

title_review: You Would Be "Loca" To Pass This Up
review_preview: We found this cozy restaurant quite by accident while we were waiting for a key to our rental apartment across the street on Carretas Street. What began as drinks turned into dinner. In fact, we so enjoyed our dinner experience that we returned the following...
review_full: We found this cozy restaurant quite by accident while we were waiting for a key to our rental apartment across the street on Carretas Street. What began as drinks turned into dinner. In fact, we so enjoyed our dinner experience that we returned the following evening for a second dinner. I loved the tuna (served medium rare with blackened sesame seeds) the waitress recommended so much that I ate it both nights (and still crave it). This is a great spot on a quite side street away from the hustle and bustle of the Puerta del Sol (1 block away), and you may eat indoors or outdoors (we did both on different nights). A mug of beer was 2.5 euros compared to 4.00 or more on various plazas. Eva is a gem of a waitress. She and her team of waitstaff are very professional, friendly and attentive. The chef is exceptional.

title_review: Great ambiance, amazing and surprising dishes!
review_preview: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Madrid to take visitors to. It's located right in the center of Sol. The food is amazing, very special and surprising dishes with Spanish influences. They have some traditional Spanish dishes like paella and fried eggplant, but...
review_full: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Madrid to take visitors to. It's located right in the center of Sol. The food is amazing, very special and surprising dishes with Spanish influences. They have some traditional Spanish dishes like paella and fried eggplant, but also contemporary dishes, so it's basically great for everyone! The ambiance is very cosy and homely with its creative decorations. The service is also nice, which is sometimes rare to find in restaurants in Madrid. The only thing is that you HAVE to book your reservation in advance because especially in weekends it's always full. I would recommend their fresh tuna, it's served in such a fun way! And their different variations of sangria are also amazing.

title_review: Don't judge a book by its cover...
review_preview: It doesn't look very promising from the outside and my dad was skeptical while we were sitting outside in the wind on the pavement beside a road. I stuck with it because of the good reviews and we were all very glad we did. We...
review_full: It doesn't look very promising from the outside and my dad was skeptical while we were sitting outside in the wind on the pavement beside a road. I stuck with it because of the good reviews and we were all very glad we did. We saw other people with blankets and so asked for some for us, and then the drinks arrived which were all generously served and helped to warm us up. When the food came, its quality and originality took us all by surprise. We had the tapas Breton, some chicken cigarillos and wild boar crepes which were all delicious and very different from your standard tourist tapas fare. We ordered some more drinks afterwards and were well on our way to a merry night by then. We were brought plenty of free nibbles and a farewell shooter each, which amused my parents. The measures are ridiculously generous and they seem to specialize in gin and tonic which really hit the spot.  A posh night out it ain't, El Mininbar is a little local spot with great and well-priced food and drinks that would suit an informal place to meet friends or start a night out. We'll be back, but I might leave my parents at the hotel next time.

The flavors when it all came together was okay, but the bread was old and stale. Supposedly this won some kind of tapa award. I am doubtful of that. Second we ordered what was supposed to be a croquette sampler with a variety of flavors. All 8 croquettes were seafood, no variety there. Had some drinks which were nothing special. Would not go back

title_review: Non-touristy within a mass of tourist bars/restaurants
review_preview: We read reviews for El miniBAR and many others and decided to try this one.  It's a below ground, smallish place that seems to attract a younger crowd, but there were all ages represented.  We asked our waitress for recommendations on tapas and she hit...
review_full: We read reviews for El miniBAR and many others and decided to try this one. It's a below ground, smallish place that seems to attract a younger crowd, but there were all ages represented. We asked our waitress for recommendations on tapas and she hit a home run with 4 suggestions. There were only 2 of us, and when we ordered her 4 recommendations, she said, "Oh, I think that will be too much food." The reason? One of the selections only came in the larger size. She was absolutely right; I couldn't finish my portion of the red tuna. It was fantastic; I just couldn't do it. The staff was more than attentive. Any one of the staff that happened by would whisk away any empty dishes. We were impressed with the food, the wine, and the staff. We would definitely return on our next visit to Madrid.

review_preview: I was directed here by the good Tripadvisor reviews but left disappointed by the food and service.My partner had the scrambled egg toast with eels and was reasonably happy with her meal, no complaints.I ordered the 'Iberico chunk', which turned out to be...
review_full: I was directed here by the good Tripadvisor reviews but left disappointed by the food and service. My partner had the scrambled egg toast with eels and was reasonably happy with her meal, no complaints. I ordered the 'Iberico chunk', which turned out to be like a pork stir fry and looked very nice. There were seven or eight pieces of pork accompanied by vegetables.  Unfortunately, three of the pieces were not cooked. I had to spit some out, which was not very pleasant. I brought this to the waitress' attention when she collected the plates. I did not receive an apology, just 'Do you want more?'. I declined. When I went inside to pay, I explained that I did not feel I should pay full price for this particular dish but had no issue paying for everything else. She reacted by suggesting that most of the meal was fine so I was not getting any 'free food'. I remained polite but this was one of the customer experiences I have ever had. The customer was an irrelevance and no explanation or apology was forthcoming. I would avoid this business, I am very disappointed given the reviews.

review_full: Was guided to this bar opposite the Tryp Ambassador hotel by TripAdvisor. A great discovery as otherwise I might have ignored it, it's quite understated from the outside during the day. Great cocktails and drinks, really lovely atmosphere, very friendly staff and all served with a touch of theatre (the gin & tonic served by pouring the tonic down the knife used to cut the limes, drinks served with a small try of jelly beans etc, great touches). The tapas is excellent if from a relatively limited menu, and the overall experience is top notch. We went several times over our trip to Madrid and it was unfailingly brilliant each time. Really recommended.

review_preview: We went here on our first night in Spain and absolutely loved it. We had a G&T and it was delicious, poured at the table in a fun way too. We ordered the tapa Breton, a winner of the best tapas in Madrid 2013, and...
review_full: We went here on our first night in Spain and absolutely loved it. We had a G&T and it was delicious, poured at the table in a fun way too. We ordered the tapa Breton, a winner of the best tapas in Madrid 2013, and it was delicious! Definitely try it if you go there, it's grilled cheese, served with a tomato jam, coriander, balsamic and oil with bread on the side. It's very rich but a must! We also had the breaded calamarie which was also amazing. That was enough to fill the two of us but we couldn't resist the brownie desert. Also had a few wines which were really good. Cost around 40 euro in total. The waiters were really friendly too and it had a local feel about it. Absolutely loved it and would recommend you got here if you're in Madrid!

title_review: Great little place right opposite the Tryp Ambassador hotel
review_preview: We went to this place based on Trip Advisor recommendations and were glad that we did it was really very good (4.5 / 5). It is directly opposite the Tryp Ambassador hotel which is where we were staying. As others have said it doesn't look...
review_full: We went to this place based on Trip Advisor recommendations and were glad that we did it was really very good (4.5 / 5). It is directly opposite the Tryp Ambassador hotel which is where we were staying. As others have said it doesn't look a lot, in fact I hadn't noticed it while coming into and out the hotel. Once sat down, the staff were great - not much English spoken so we went with our limited Spanish and the English descriptions on the menu and it worked out fine. The Tapas we had was excellent - their award winning cheese special was great. We arrived early (7:30pm) and had to wait until 8:00pm (they looked closed on Sunday) for the food to start but had an excellent looking Gin & Tonic while we waited. The place was full when we left with a mixture of locals and visitors creating a lively atmosphere. Try this place if you want a great Tapas bar slightly off the main tourist routes.

title_review: Amazing atmosphere and food at great prices
review_preview: I'm not one to usually leave a review but this place needs a special mention. After a bad start for the holiday, this was our 1st dining experience in Madrid and what a lovely place to spend it. The atmosphere is modern and relaxed with...
review_full: I'm not one to usually leave a review but this place needs a special mention.  After a bad start for the holiday, this was our 1st dining experience in Madrid and what a lovely place to spend it.  The atmosphere is modern and relaxed with exceptionally tasty food at extremely reasonable prices  We opted for a paella, x2 bottles of Rioja which came to £35.  The house even have us x2 glasses of wine on the house (it was fair to say we had a good time)  If your a meat lover look out for there stake platter, and if there are more then x4 of you then I'd personally opt for both paella and steak, you won't leave hungry.  I hope the rest of out holiday eats live up to this place.  A real gem

review_preview: Just off Plaza Mayor a real gem. We went in and the place was empty so we were a little unsure but as soon as we were greeted and sat we knew we'd be ok. Actually we were better than ok - the food was...
review_full: Just off Plaza Mayor a real gem. We went in and the place was empty so we were a little unsure but as soon as we were greeted and sat we knew we'd be ok. Actually we were better than ok - the food was gorgeous, no other word for it. The service was great, the staff took the time to explain the dishes but weren't too much. Both my husband and I said that this was probably some of the nicest food we had ever had. We went to Bodin the following night and instead of staying for coffee and dessert we returned to Metro Bistro and they were more than happy to let us just have coffee and some of their gorgeous chocolates.  Would definitely recommend the chocolate selection for dessert - all homemade and to die for.  The bill was a lovely surprise too, very reasonable. Would definitely recommend Metro Bistro to anyone wanting to have a great meal, we will be back on our next visit to Madrid

review_preview: There was a big trade show in Madrid this year and I chose this restaurant for a business dinner, which was a big mistake.I went to this restaurant a few days earlier to make sure if this restaurant was suitable for the business dinner....
review_full: There was a big trade show in Madrid this year and I chose this restaurant for a business dinner, which was a big mistake. I went to this restaurant a few days earlier to make sure if this restaurant was suitable for the business dinner. A staff member confirmed my booking and told to reserve a big table nearby the window. On that dinner date, I was waiting at the reception to be served. However, a group of (stupid) people cut in the line and surprisingly took the window table! I spoke to the staff member whom I spoke to the other day but she said the table was occupied and they were preparing another table. The table was in the noisiest part of restaurant, we felt quite uncomfortable. The food was average at best, we had four more business dinners during the show, this was the worst in every way. When checking out, we were told that the credit card reader was not working and there was an ATM over there. I refused to fetch money (also cashing incurs an interest and a cashing fee), then the staff said "This is not working, OK you can stay here all the night!". What a rude person! This was not our fault at all, how dare could she behave like that? A couple of more customers were also told like this and got frustrated. I can see many positive reviews for this second or third class restaurant, but I do suggest there are many more better choices in Madrid.

title_review: You can't tell a book by its cover
review_preview: We found this place on Trip Advisor and decided to drop by one evening to see whether we would like to go there the next day.  It was not inviting looking at all.  It is quite small with only a couple of tables inside and...
review_full: We found this place on Trip Advisor and decided to drop by one evening to see whether we would like to go there the next day. It was not inviting looking at all. It is quite small with only a couple of tables inside and the outdoor seating was very messy looking. We had just about written it off, but I took another look at the reviews and thought we would give it a try. Wow! We went for a late lunch and sat outdoors in the shade and had a fantastic meal. For such a small place, the tapas they come up with are outstanding. They are quite complex and way above any of the other ones we had during our stay. We had their award-winning tapa Breton, a melted cheese dish; capresse, and minced meat with guacamole on toast. Everything was delicious.

review_preview: Never stopped at this little tapas restaurant across from our hotel because it was always full - now know why. This may be the best tapas restaurant in Spain! Yes, it is unassuming, and the tapas are fabulous. Tried the Rabas de Calamar - corn...
review_full: Never stopped at this little tapas restaurant across from our hotel because it was always full - now know why. This may be the best tapas restaurant in Spain! Yes, it is unassuming, and the tapas are fabulous. Tried the Rabas de Calamar - corn batter fried squid with arugula salad and aioli (yummy); Salmoreja (best in Spain, not too thick, great accompaniments); Tapa Breton (2013 best tapa winner in Spain, crusty, melted cheese with coriander and quince jelly-incredible); Tinto de Verano (sangria with mint); gin and tonic (so different!). Service was great, location is near Plaza Oriente and the Opera, value is good, can't believe we found this little gem on our last day in Spain! Don't miss this terrific little tapas restaurant.

title_review: Just awesome food! What else do you need.?
review_preview: This little place at the end of plaza Santo. Domingo looks just like the other thousand joint in Madrid, but don't be fooled, there's much more. The place says nothing from the outside and it doesn't get much better inside. We got an outdoor table...
review_full: This little place at the end of plaza Santo. Domingo looks just like the other thousand joint in Madrid, but don't be fooled, there's much more. The place says nothing from the outside and it doesn't get much better inside. We got an outdoor table on a wonderful night in June and just asked the owner what to order. We had tapa Breton and canutillos filled with boar. Just excellent, in every way. The tapa Breton was one of the best dishes I had in Spain. Complex in flavor and yet simple to enjoy. I'll be going back to try some more dishes this week. Staff is extremely accommodating and friendly, they really run a great place.

title_review: Degustation menu - excellent value for money
review_preview: We visited the Metro Bistro near Plaza Mayor on a Saturday evening (it was Halloween, so we had made a reservation a few weeks back already). We opted for the 7 course degustation menu (38€ per person). It included pumpkin soup, deep fried anemones, smoked...
review_full: We visited the Metro Bistro near Plaza Mayor on a Saturday evening (it was Halloween, so we had made a reservation a few weeks back already).  We opted for the 7 course degustation menu (38€ per person). It included pumpkin soup, deep fried anemones, smoked eel with vegetables, scallop with black rise, long cooked lamb, pineapple cannelloni with mango mousse as well as an assortment of chocolate desserts.  The food was amazing - really delicious, well prepared and the portions were good size. It was a bargain for this price. In addition we had a bottle of Priorat red wine, water, 2 coffees and 2 sweet wines with the desserts (do try the Spanish, sweet white wine with the cannelloni and Pedro Ximenes with the chocolates). The price for all this: 107€!!! Excellent value I would say (in Finland similar meal would cost at least two times the same)!

review_full: From the outside the restaurant looks quite small, however it's large enough don't worry. First thing I was really happy about was that tables are not crammed together so you can talk without being overheard. Next thing was the starter and the dessert. For starter we shared potatoes with three different dips (thank you for recommending TA reviewer). This was really really really good! For the dessert we had pineapple cannelloni and of course a tribute to chocolate (cannelloni is better imo if you are not dark chocolate lover through and through). The only thing I was a little bit disappointed about was that we would really prefer some potatoes, more vegetables or something with our meal (maybe this was our fault and we were supposed to order sides?) but that should not discourage you from going, especially if you are looking for something little bit fancier.

review_preview: We made a reservation on the internet before we arrived in Madrid and when we sat down were each given a "celery mojito" in a small sugar-rimmed glass - so nice!We tried the Metro potato appetizer, which was excellent in that the potatoes were...
review_full: We made a reservation on the internet before we arrived in Madrid and when we sat down were each given a "celery mojito" in a small sugar-rimmed glass - so nice! We tried the Metro potato appetizer, which was excellent in that the potatoes were both crunchy and meaty and the sauces were inventive and tasty. French Fries elevated. I had a tenderloin filet with potatoes gratin and she had scallops on a black rice cake with a soft curry sauce. Both were excellent. A trio of chocolates - sweet, bitter and mousse - was very nice pairing to finish the last of our rioja. Very nice place, would definitely return to sample more of their wonderfully flavorful and presented food.

review_full: Read the great reviews & decided to try this restaurant. Arrived about 9-15 & hardly anyone inside which made us wonder about going in. Would have been a big mistake if we had not, especially as it started to fill up after we were seated. The restaurant itself is very nicely decorated which immediately gives you a good feel about it. From start to finish the food was delightfully imaginative, inventive & just delicious, even the bread & the butter at the start. The table next to us were having the 7 course taster menu which we would love to have had but it would have been too much. This is a chef at the top of his game, the presentation was a delight & the staff were nothing but helpful. This is a must visit restaurant.

Fantastic value for money. Less than €40 for a meal for 3 including drinks. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting this city.

Service is fast and friendly, constantly checking to see how your meals were, great advice on the menu so if you go and have no idea what to get just ask the staff ! Might even go back there tomorrow before we leave Madrid :)

title_review: Very good but short of excellent
review_preview: We were attracted to the Metro Bistro by the very strong pattern of reviews and perhaps a little by the fact that it is quite close to our hotel in the Calle Atocha.  But although it was an acceptable hour for early dining in Spain,...
review_full: We were attracted to the Metro Bistro by the very strong pattern of reviews and perhaps a little by the fact that it is quite close to our hotel in the Calle Atocha. But although it was an acceptable hour for early dining in Spain, we almost gave it a miss because it was so empty. However the reviews won the day and we decided to give it a try in the expectation that it would fill up a bit later.  The seven course Taster Menu looked to be good value and we chose that, although a bit surprised to find that it was, as we later read on their web site, “a tour of their kitchen” or more correctly a tour of their menu rather than the bespoke set of dishes that we have become used to elsewhere. Overall it was a pleasing tour with some stops being better than others. The scallop on a black rice bed was excellent but the escalivada was trying too hard; the sea anemones with seaweed was interesting and the finale tribute to chocolate was sublime. It may sound a strange complaint, but because the courses were dishes from the menu they were on the large size for seven courses. However the service was excellent and the waitress and kitchen responded well to our request to slow down the delivery a bit towards the end. We would not go so far as some other reviewers to say “the best in Madrid” but it was very good value and an enjoyable meal. Pity about the empty tables that did not fill up as anticipated.

title_review: Unique, Delicious, and Want to Go Back
review_preview: After being in Spain for two weeks, and many of the food offerings in the Spanish restaurants were similar, it was really refreshing to experience this fantastic place.Everything from the service to the food, and the unique way everything was presented, was just out...
review_full: After being in Spain for two weeks, and many of the food offerings in the Spanish restaurants were similar, it was really refreshing to experience this fantastic place. Everything from the service to the food, and the unique way everything was presented, was just out of this world. Every dish was really wonderful. On many recommendations, we tried the sea treasures (anemones), which you don't see often on menus. It's a must try. The steak tartare was perfectly prepared with incredible flavor combinations. We had a lot of croquettes on our vacation, and these were by far the best. If you're a chocolate fan like we are, the tribute to chocolate is outstanding, and the perfect way to wrap up the meal. Each item represented chocolate from a different area of the world, and was really interesting to experience the difference with every bite. Loved this place!

review_full: it's a real shame to have such a nice restaurant with delicious food to eat and to have such a disgraceful and disrespectful manager. Her name is DANAE, she is pretty but has no customer service skills indeed we have booked a table for 3 peoples on December 1, 2019, very disappointed by the reception of this person so unpleasant and especially who does not know how to manage her stress and the contact with customers I am more than 7 months pregnant and we kindly asked her to let me wait inside knowing that my friends were ready to patiently wait outside she refused categorically while it was raining heavily and I did not feel well and was a bit scared to get sick  Then when she finally decided to give us a table while there were several free tables downstairs, she gives us a high talble with high chair which is very uncomfortable for a woman pregnant more than 7 months. We asked her to give us another table because it is uncomfortable for a pregnant woman she refused without even trying to find a solution to try to satisfy customers what is part of his work. We are still staying because I was too tired to find another restaurant but also because we had booked and if we cancel we must pay fees which is not normal especially with the host received by DANAE Luckily the meal was a total success the cook is wonderful the food is delicious and I recommend it to everyone it is worth it to go there please believe me the place is beautiful and the food so tasty. Especially the treatment of 3 waiters who did everything to make us forget the bad experience lived with DANAE, a french waiter Kevin very nice who made us magic tricks and was really attentive to us. Yola who advised us most of the dishes we loved all the dishes advised and finally Sebas who was very attentive too and give us some shots and one without alcohol for me as he knew I was pregnant. We thank very much these 3 waiters because thanks to them we will surely come back hoping to find another manager who will have a little more respect for customers who come to spend money because the Menu is far from low prices.

review_full: El miniBAR promised to feed us ( via Facebook) even though we were arriving late into Madrid. We turned up after midnight but needn't have worried because the boys in the bar happily fired up the kitchen and served us tasty tapas. The beer was great, Estrella on draft. Also the cocktails were authentic and generous. The overall look of the place was a bit haphazard and without a theme but the friendly welcome more than made up for this. We went back for a drink the following night and were met with another warm and genuine welcome. If I'm ever in Madrid again I'll be sure to pop in for a snack and a beer.

title_review: Tiny local place with good tapas
review_preview: We went for a light tapa meal one night and found this on TA.  We followed the recommendations from previous reviewers.  We tried the Tapa Breton, which was a large  square of cheese that had been quickly melted and was served with a tomato jam,...
review_full: We went for a light tapa meal one night and found this on TA. We followed the recommendations from previous reviewers. We tried the Tapa Breton, which was a large square of cheese that had been quickly melted and was served with a tomato jam, pesto, and large strands of saffron. Absolutely rich and tasty. We also tried the wild boar rolls, which were like two large egg rolls that had been stuffed full with a shredded wild boar meat. Also totally unusual and delicious. The beer and wine were extremely inexpensive and so our "meal" ended up being less that $20. Well worth it!

review_preview: In Madrid the good restaurants are generally not convenient to find without reviews from Trip Advisor or Google. Oven, however, is an exception. Located on the Gran Via, it's very easy to find. I visited on a Monday night and there were about five or...
review_full: In Madrid the good restaurants are generally not convenient to find without reviews from Trip Advisor or Google. Oven, however, is an exception.  Located on the Gran Via, it's very easy to find. I visited on a Monday night and there were about five or six tables occupied. It's a fairly large place compared to other restaurants or wine bars.  The food was very good, as was the house white wine. And the prices were very reasonable...€18 for two glasses of wine and dinner.  While Trip Advisor calls it Oven Gran Via, it's really just called Oven. This is a great restaurant and it would be very good to go there with friends. I would definitely visit again. I recommend it strongly and you won't be disappointed.

We got sangrias that were cheap (3.50e) and served in large fish-bowl like glasses, absolutely delicious! Price of tapas ranged from 6-8e which is decent.

title_review: Cosy, quick, cheap - and a great response.
review_preview: Another recommendation from Alicia at the Dear Hotel front desk (she should be a restaurant critic!).Tucked away downstairs near Plaza Major, thiis tapas joint has a lot of energy, fun staff who look like they’ve stepped straight off the street and a really nice...
review_full: Another recommendation from Alicia at the Dear Hotel front desk (she should be a restaurant critic!). Tucked away downstairs near Plaza Major, thiis tapas joint has a lot of energy, fun staff who look like they’ve stepped straight off the street and a really nice menu and wine offering. We had their speciality, a wild boar roll that was to die for, some good standard croquettes and a slightly strange dish of hot sweet grilled cheese swimming in jam (which we were told had won a “best tapas in Madrid” award. Now, on another night it might have worked for us, and it might work for you, but we couldn’t get into it. When we told our waiter, though, he was totally cool and refused to charge us for it, even when I insisted. That’s style! We didn’t stay long, we paid very little for a good experience. Definitely recommend it.

review_preview: Service was excellent here and was what we enjoyed most at this place. When we arrived we were told to wait 15 minutes for our table. We decided to get drinks first while waiting at the bar and were given free  tapas with the drinks!...
review_full: Service was excellent here and was what we enjoyed most at this place. When we arrived we were told to wait 15 minutes for our table. We decided to get drinks first while waiting at the bar and were given free tapas with the drinks! As soon as we were seated, the staff who spoke great English gave us food recommendations according to our preferences and they taught us about the different combinations and portions. We ordered the cod fish which was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The portion was just nice for 2 people. We also ordered the chicken tenders with 3 sauces: teriyaki, thai sweet chilli and tartar, which was average. Lastly we had the fried spring roll with boar meat which was highly recommended by the staff and indeed it did not let us down. Would definitely recommend.

review_preview: I googled best tapas bars in Madrid and this one came up an was very close to where we were staying.  We didn't have a reservation but they offered us a table in the back room upstairs which we accepted.  The service was friendly and...
review_full: I googled best tapas bars in Madrid and this one came up an was very close to where we were staying. We didn't have a reservation but they offered us a table in the back room upstairs which we accepted. The service was friendly and helpful, but I felt very rushed - in terms of choosing a drink; then it felt like hurry up what do you want to eat when we had literally had the menu for 30 seconds. The waitress offered to help us choose and when I politely declined one of the recommendations because I don't like coconut milk she argued with me. The food was delivered quick smart and before we had finished our first drink the food had been delivered, eaten and the plates and table items had been whisked away again which had made us feel they wanted to us to eat quickly and leave - which we did. The restaurant is obviously very popular and very busy because when we were leaving they were turning people away who did not have bookings. The food was ok but I would have probably done better if I had been given time to read through the menu options properly without being rushed through to choose. Would I come back? Probably not. I was expecting to spend a nice evening out and we were in and out in 30 minutes. They must be doing something right though because they are obviously very popular.

review_preview: We were so lucky in finding the Mini-Bar right outside the front door of our hotel. We had read about the great reviews in trip advisor and had been planning on trying it. The first night we were warmly greeted by "Nutso" (not sure of...
review_full: We were so lucky in finding the Mini-Bar right outside the front door of our hotel. We had read about the great reviews in trip advisor and had been planning on trying it. The first night we were warmly greeted by "Nutso" (not sure of the spelling). He got us a table in a corner, got wine to us quickly and helped us understand the menu. He highly recommended the "Tapa Briton" which was outstanding to say the least. We had other Tapas which were also very good but the friendliness of Nutso and a waitress, Sylvia really made us feel welcome and the service was terrific. We liked it so much we came back two more nights! We also had carmelized chicken wedges and carmelized pork wedges which were excellent. There is no need for dinner after visiting the "Mini Bar"

title_review: Best Burger in Town!! And the Town is MADRID!!!
review_preview: To celebrate my 60th birthday in early April /2016, I traveled with a best friend to Spain...While we were in Madrid, we discovered a great place to have an American-style burger...The restaurant is called "Steakburgers", and is centrally located and quite near the Reina Sophia...
review_full: To celebrate my 60th birthday in early April /2016, I traveled with a best friend to Spain...While we were in Madrid, we discovered a great place to have an American-style burger...The restaurant is called "Steakburgers", and is centrally located and quite near the Reina Sophia museum. The burgers were great, and you can order them not only to the doneness you prefer, but also in the size you would like, measured in grams!! It makes McDonald's Quarterpounders seem skimpy by comparison!! You have a choice of hard or soft rolls, and you can order fabulous appetizers as well such as chicken tenders or onion rings and the wait staff was always very friendly and attentive...I must mention our waitress, Jimena, who made us feel so welcome and at home, and made sure we had a great meal and an enjoyable time. If you are feeling even the slightest bit homesick for a good old American style hamburger, this is definitely the place you want to eat!! Better yet, prices were extremely reasonable! We ended up eating there several times during our stay in Madrid...

title_review: Excellent pizza for a reasonable price
review_preview: The restaurant is situated right on the Gran Via, which is a very busy street in Madrid. It looks like it's one of those places that are 50% more expensive than a similar restaurant in a shady sidestreet just because of its location.I was...
review_full: The restaurant is situated right on the Gran Via, which is a very busy street in Madrid.  It looks like it's one of those places that are 50% more expensive than a similar restaurant in a shady sidestreet just because of its location. I was glad to find out it wasn't: the prices are very reasonable (11 euro for a Pizza Diavola), and the pizza is excellent. The waiters are friendly and most of them speak English.  Overall this place was well worth the 30-minute walk from our apartment.

If you're in Madrid you must eat here! Don't miss it!

review_preview: I'm giving this place 1 star because it may have given false advertising across the board at some point saying it's meat was halal. Me and my friends were looking for halal places to eat in Madrid and this was listed on fork.com as top...
review_full: I'm giving this place 1 star because it may have given false advertising across the board at some point saying it's meat was halal. Me and my friends were looking for halal places to eat in Madrid and this was listed on fork.com as top 10 halal places to eat in Madrid as well as other places. We went to the restaurant and asked the employees directly there who told us that it is not a halal place.  Apologies if this is no fault of the restaurant but I just wanted to clear this up for any others who found the same information as us and weren't sure if this place was or not.  It does not say it is a halal anywhere on their menu but other reviewers said it was which led us to believing it might be halal in private. Again I repeat it is not halal. Literally 15 seconds down the road though is a nice little halal kebab and Shisha place which we decided to go to after and it is nice, named Jola, which you might want to check out.

title_review: Loved it so much we went 3 times in 3 days!
review_preview: We were looking for a cheap meal in Madrid and this was one of the most highly recommended low cost places on Tripadvisor. We were initially skeptical as the restaurant was in a very touristy lane near Plaza del Sol, but we were wrong to...
review_full: We were looking for a cheap meal in Madrid and this was one of the most highly recommended low cost places on Tripadvisor. We were initially skeptical as the restaurant was in a very touristy lane near Plaza del Sol, but we were wrong to worry. We came initially on a night after having some underwhelming and overpriced tapas elsewhere. We enjoyed the gazpacho, pork, stuffed peppers, salad and, most of all, the Galician octopus. The food was great - simple, but well prepared - and we had fantastic, friendly service. We were offered a 10% discount card if we returned, so we duly came back the following night and tried some different dishes - the croquettes and pork were highlights. Our waitress (the same as the previous night) was kind enough to give us each a glass of wine on the house. We ended up coming back a third time on our last day in Madrid for lunch, where we had all our favourite dishes. Couldn't recommend this one highly enough!

title_review: Great food at a good price
review_preview: El miniBAR is a small restaurant with a personality. Crammed in a basement it offers incredible tapas at more than decent prices. While it is not a fancy restaurant the service was just great, the waitress very fast in bringing the food and clearing the...
review_full: El miniBAR is a small restaurant with a personality. Crammed in a basement it offers incredible tapas at more than decent prices. While it is not a fancy restaurant the service was just great, the waitress very fast in bringing the food and clearing the table. Try the tapas, not the portions. Tapas are big enough and you get to try more. As for how many tapas you should get... 3/2 persons (or maybe 4 if you very hungry). And also - if it is hard to decide - ask the waitress for advice... their recommendations were very good!

review_preview: In searching for a good tapas restaurant near el Palacio Real, we found El Minibar. The staff were very friendly and enthusiastic in explaining the specials of the day and recommending their tapas in both Spanish and English. We each had a glass of tinto...
review_full: In searching for a good tapas restaurant near el Palacio Real, we found El Minibar. The staff were very friendly and enthusiastic in explaining the specials of the day and recommending their tapas in both Spanish and English. We each had a glass of tinto at the bar with a complimentary tapa (bread topped with cheese and greens), then ordered a serving of croquetas and bocadillos (small sandwiches on delicious thick bread) to share. One bocadillo had pork loin, roasted eggplant, brie, and aioli; the other had tuna, tomato, and olives. Everything was excellent for a light, well-priced bite. Definitely worth the trip if you’re touring the city center!

review_preview: A dinner at the place was actually a small birthday dinner so I wanted to make a reservation before. It wasn’t a problem to make one even though the place is usually full of people. However when we got to the place it appeared that...
review_full: A dinner at the place was actually a small birthday dinner so I wanted to make a reservation before. It wasn’t a problem to make one even though the place is usually full of people. However when we got to the place it appeared that they made a mistake with a reservation and instead of a table for 10 people it was made for 2. We had to wait for around 15-20 minutes but afterwards everything went fine. A waiter recommended taking not tapas but so-called raciones to share and out of his top 6 we took 5. All were very tasty, we had fish with shrimps, some meat like beef or bacon and also cheese which rocked the meal. Definitely worth asking the waiter, they tend to know the menu the best! In general it wasn’t also very expensive, each one paid around 12€ (food and drinks included). For sure el miniBAR is a place to revisit!

title_review: Makes you feel at home from the beginning!
review_preview: Right as I entered the restaurant, Lydia the hostess greeted my family and I with the biggest smile, making us feel very welcomed. As we went down to get seated, she introduced my group to the cooks and waiters who all greeted me by name...
review_full: Right as I entered the restaurant, Lydia the hostess greeted my family and I with the biggest smile, making us feel very welcomed. As we went down to get seated, she introduced my group to the cooks and waiters who all greeted me by name when they found out my name was Enrique. Ivan, Dario and Jorge were all great and attentive. They always made sure our cups were full and our taste buds satisfied. The food was also great! I recommend their Rose Sangria, Iberian Ham Croquettes, Grilled Pork Tenderloin, Tuna Tataki and Surf and Turf Paella. Amazing flavors to warm a person's heart. Add to that the restaurant's unique decorations and you've got an experience that is a must if you happen to find yourself in Madrid.

We asked for their best/favorite tapas and they began bringing some of the best foodie small plates out, each one better than the one before. They were each served in these dishes that were amazing. You just have to go to see for yourself. It was a wonderful evening and very reasonable for the amount and quality of the food. It was the most enjoyable meal I have had in years.

review_preview: I was definitely craving tapas and chose this place based on reviews, menu, and their prices.  I liked the easy to read menu listed both in Spanish and English. The waitress provided us with two bite sized bread topped with tuna.  It was quite tasty....
review_full: I was definitely craving tapas and chose this place based on reviews, menu, and their prices. I liked the easy to read menu listed both in Spanish and English. The waitress provided us with two bite sized bread topped with tuna. It was quite tasty. My husband ordered the Iberian Sirloin Chunk tapa, which was delicious and perfectly cooked with onions, bell peppers, and zucchini. I did order the grilled goat cheese, only because it was a favorite at this restaurant, and it did not disappoint. I never had anything like this and it's worth trying, especially if you get to share it with someone else. It's a lot of cheese for one person, unless you are a serious cheese lover. We did get here early so no reservations needed, but the place was full on a Wednesday evening by the time we left. So, I do recommend that you make reservations if you plan on coming after 8pm. Enjoy!

The only bad thing about our experience was the time it took to bring us the food. almost 25 minutes for the starters and then another 20 to 25 minutes for the main course. we complained about the time and they gave us a free desert to choose from which was nice of them. the desert we took(chocolate fundant) was only OK nothing special. Overall we had an awesome meal.

review_preview: I went on trip advisor (plug plug) to find the best steakhouse in Madrid and chose the Cabana based on reviews. It's a cracking little restaurant based in the very busy Principe area which is rammed with bars eateries and people- incredibly busy.The restaurant...
review_full: I went on trip advisor (plug plug) to find the best steakhouse in Madrid and chose the Cabana based on reviews. It's a cracking little restaurant based in the very busy Principe area which is rammed with bars eateries and people- incredibly busy. The restaurant is not massive with I'd guess around twenty tables and has a great vibe. There are plenty of waiters/waitresses so you don't have to wait around if anything is required.  The steaks come with nothing else however the sides are huge, at least big enough for two. I had the tenderloin and it was one of the best steaks I've had, cooked to perfection (rare obviously!). Our waitress Geraldine spoke good English and recommended a great Malbec which wasn't too expensive. She was attentive and good fun and if going to the restaurant definitely ask for her to be your server. The maitre d' was unobtrusive, good, but there if needed and added to the great atmosphere, helped by a free glass of fizz in the front bar afterwards.  Bill for two including wine was €90 and worth every penny. Go there.

review_full: While exploring Madrid with my students, we noticed this restaurant that served burgers. Because we have been traveling with a group, we have had to eat at places that can accommodate large numbers and serve meals at an affordable price. My students were tired of the food that we had been getting and decided to give it go. Since the morning, we knew we were going their for dinner. We craved it all day and we were not disappointed. We loved it and wished we had known about it night one. Great music, friendly staff, and BEST BURGER I have ever had in Europe. If you are above eating American food in Europe, don't eat here. I absolutely loved it and so did my students. It made for a great last night in Madrid for students who are about to go back to the states.

review_preview: We booked this restaurant on our last night in Madrid after a tour of three weeks. Went with a few friends and food was great. We were all ready for a steak and we were not disappointed. We ordered sautéed vegetables and roasted potatoes to...
review_full: We booked this restaurant on our last night in Madrid after a tour of three weeks. Went with a few friends and food was great. We were all ready for a steak and we were not disappointed. We ordered sautéed vegetables and roasted potatoes to share, and ordered ribeye,skewered lamb and tenderloin, one with pepper sauce. All were cooked to perfection. Serves were large and the veges and potatoes were enough for the four of us. To start, they brought out olives, pate and rolls. We shared a bottle of red. For dessert, three had a crepe and one a Tiramisu and all enjoyed. Service was fast and friendly. We booked at 8pm which is still early for Spain, you should book if thinking of going there.  The menu is extensive and serve other dishes than steak.

Considering the quality of food and drinks it was very reasonable at only 60 euros. I would love to return if in Madrid again.

We ordered a tomato and mozzarella salad that was unbelievably fresh, some outstanding croquettes that we perfectly cooked and tasted incredible and some squid with garlic aioli that was just fantastic. I will look forward to my next visit to Madrid simply to visit this great little eatery again!

As side dish, I recommend the Provencal-like fries (with parsley) or the potato. As desert, you can try the crepe filled with Argentinian artisan caramel cream. Wines, both red and white, are also very good, so do not hesitate to try some and ask for recommendations to the nice staff.  This place is now on my list every time I go to Madrid. Same for my beef-lover partner.
