review_preview: This started off bad tonight and ended worse.I used the restaurants website to request a reservation. Their auto reply said they would contact us to confirm the reservation. They didn't.My daughter who speaks Spanish contacted the restaurant  and they did not have our...
review_full: This started off bad tonight and ended worse. I used the restaurants website to request a reservation. Their auto reply said they would contact us to confirm the reservation. They didn't. My daughter who speaks Spanish contacted the restaurant and they did not have our reservation so she made one.  One of the servers seemed annoyed we weren't ordering drinks. Oh well! My family of 4 ordered three Ribeyes, 2 of which were 500kg (1 lb) and a skirt steak which appeared to be about 500 kg, de la Casa salad (Lettuce, Apple, Roquefort cheese, celery and walnuts). The salad was being shared so we requested the Roquefort, which has a bold taste, on the side. They didn't prepare it that way and cheese was sprinkled over the entire salad. That aside, the salad was tasty. I requested my steak be prepared medium-well. This should provide me a light pink inside. The waitress said they would have to cut the meat to get it med-well. I'm assuming she meant butterflyed, but passed on it not wanting a well-done piece of dried out meat. All 3 pieces including the 300 kg (small cut) came out med-rare. We send back a 300 & 500 kg Ribeyes. The smaller cut came back perfect & the larger cut was about the same as originally prepared. The skirts steak is served on a skillet over a mini hibachi. I used the hibachi to cook my Ribeye the rest of the way. Overall, the steak was good, far from great. The only side ordered was a baked potato which was quite tasty. Note: it is typical that beef is prepared more toward rare so be prepared to send it back. Our table was cleared & the check was brought over. We felt rushed!  What about dessert ??? We ordered 3 desserts;  Lemon sorbet Mango sorbet, vodka, caramelized orange and vanilla ice cream  Crepe filled with argentinian artisan caramel cream  The first 2 are actually beverages. The lemon sorbet has rum (?) In it. Both were tasty. Unfortunately, I did not get the crepe I requested & pointed to on the menu. Instead,  I received the Apple crepe flambeé with rum. Before the waitress drenched the poor crepe in rum (nor did it flambeé) we tried telling her. Then she argued with us insisting it was what was ordered.  She returned with a new dessert, but again, the wrong one; 3 small scoops of vanilla ice cream drenched in cheap chocolate sauce. Argentine Beef may be "The tastiest meat in the world," but I would choose any of the Prime steak houses in New York & Boston that I've eaten at over the Argentine cut at  La Cabańa Argentina and their poor service. A bitter taste to end to an average meal--waitress with an attitude. If you're dying for a steak, there are other steak houses in Mtadrid where the outcome must be better than what my family experienced.

review_preview: We were looking for an actual dinner place instead of just tapas for our last family dinner of our 10 day Spain trip. We really enjoyed this steak restaurant. The service was excellent from the moment we walked in the door without a reservation. They...
review_full: We were looking for an actual dinner place instead of just tapas for our last family dinner of our 10 day Spain trip. We really enjoyed this steak restaurant. The service was excellent from the moment we walked in the door without a reservation. They still found us a table for 4. The waitresses were very helpful with the menu and wine list. We had a nice bottle of Pittacum for under 20 euro. Since we knew the dinner would be large, we just ate bread and olives as our appetizer. My daughter ordered the grilled salmon which came with a nice baked potato (not like an American baked potato). I ordered the veal skewer which came with a halved tomato with a really nice vinaigrette. My husband and son shared a large strip steak at the suggestion of our waitress (which was actually cheaper than their first choice). The men shared the parmesan fries and the ladies shared the grilled vegetables. Both were very shareable and delicious. The meats were cooked perfectly as was the fish. It is obvious they take great pride in there service and quality of beef served. We are so glad we found this restaurant. We were unable to eat any desert so cannot comment on this.

Por ejemplo, cuatro euros por una pequeña empanadilla me parece un precio muy alto. También me parece caro lo que pagamos por dos patatas cocidas pequeñas, que en cualquier otro restaurante te lo ponen de acompañamiento en el mismo plato principal. I had been wanting to eat there for a long time and I think it's fine, but I do not think I'll go back. The place is nice and quiet and the waiters very friendly, but although the quality is good, the quantities are not great and the price is very high for what they give to eat. For example, four euros for a small empanadilla seems to me a very high price. I also find it expensive what I paid for two small potatoes, which at any other restaurant will put it with the same main course. And the prices of the desserts we did not even talk about. In short, very expensive for what they offer. Very expensive and you're hungry. No thanks. Bye, bye ...

review_preview: We visited here on a recommendation from a friend.  You need to book this restaurant as it's very popular and busy. Firstly I would like to comment that on the staff.  They are very attentive and friendly, explaining the menu. We ordered some wine which...
review_full: We visited here on a recommendation from a friend. You need to book this restaurant as it's very popular and busy.  Firstly I would like to comment that on the staff. They are very attentive and friendly, explaining the menu.  We ordered some wine which was very reasonable at €16 per bottle.  We both ordered fillet steak which has were absolutely fabulous. The veg was also very good and the portions are large. My only disappointment was the first I ordered. They were with garlic and parsley. The garlic was too strong for me. But if you like garlic, one portion is more than enough for 2.  We only had one course and coffee as all we seem to do in Madrid is eat and drink.  This is well worth the visit, slightly more expensive than the average restaurants but you pay for what you get. As good a steak that I've ever had!

The staff was very friendly and the manager on duty (I am guessing) was very personable and recommended things to eat. We saw people with interesting looking drinks and asked what they were. review_full: We haven’t even finished eating as I type this review but I must say that I. Am. Delighted. The food was delicious; there are two veggie options, and I absolutely recommend the goat cheese - my boyfriend is not a vegetarian, but we agreed that it was incredibly rich in taste, both salty and sweet at the same time, also with plenty of sauce. And as I’ve seen in his stuffed cheeks, the meat options were good too. And the wine - wonderful! Definitely will drop by if we ever visit Madrid again.

title_review: Great ambience, good food, fantastic cocktails!
review_preview: Great restaurant with friendly staff and very appealing decor - the sinks outside the toilets are incredible! The food was great with plenty of choice, there was decent background music playing which added to the relaxed ambience, the wines we chose were good, but the...
review_full: Great restaurant with friendly staff and very appealing decor - the sinks outside the toilets are incredible!  The food was great with plenty of choice, there was decent background music playing which added to the relaxed ambience, the wines we chose were good, but the cocktails were divine! My calzone (folded pizza) looked enormous when it arrived, but I managed to eat it, followed by a pannacotta which was gorgeous!  My mojito was first class - the pot it arrived in was thermal so by the end of the meal the ice still hadn't melted - genius! Would definitely go back.

review_preview: Looking for Paella before departing Spain, I followed the advice of an online article, which said Rosi La Loca was very good and also one of few places that serves paella for one. That turned out not to be true (perhaps it was previously), but...
review_full: Looking for Paella before departing Spain, I followed the advice of an online article, which said Rosi La Loca was very good and also one of few places that serves paella for one. That turned out not to be true (perhaps it was previously), but as I was very hungry I ordered the seafood paella anyway. Disappointingly, it was just so-so; not nearly as good as the paella I had the week before in Seville, or regularly get at a restaurant near my home. The flavor was not distinct and the rice was soft and soupy, with no crunch. On a positive note, the waiter was nice.

It has a rather chic decor, dim lighting, and the menu though not extensive, has a variety of tapas. really loved the crispy eggplant fritters - thinly sliced and fried, they were the best version of fried eggplant that I've had throughout my trip in Spain. Also had the octopus tentacle and seafarer patacon - pieces of fried fish on top of avocado and plaintain, an interesting appetiser-like dish. Special sangria was not cheap but comes in a huge glass with fruits.

review_preview: With literally hundreds of restaurants to choose from in Centro Madrid and other popular neighborhood, it's hard to go wrong (but possible) when it comes to paella. We found this popular spot online, and to be honest, it isn't full of locals. Quite the opposite....
review_full: With literally hundreds of restaurants to choose from in Centro Madrid and other popular neighborhood, it's hard to go wrong (but possible) when it comes to paella. We found this popular spot online, and to be honest, it isn't full of locals. Quite the opposite. There were people from the U.S. (us and others) Japan, other areas of Europe, New Zealand, and Canada that we knew of. And the restaurant definitely has their act together to cater to tourists, but that didn't spoil the experience at all. The decor is cheery, and the restaurant appear to be quite small from the entry, maybe seating 30 people. But having to use the "facilities" downstairs had me discovering an even larger lower level with at least another 40 seats. While even the lower level was attractive, I wouldn't want to dine here, so be sure to specify when you make a reservation, and you will need one if you want to eat anytime close to when you arrive, that main floor seating is a priority. It's just that much nicer. As for the food, it was wonderful. Our paella was the best we had in Madrid, though we did enjoy one that was perhaps a whisker superior while in Sevilla. Our servers, Roxanne and Alex, were superb, and the pricing was reasonable. Not inexpensive, but not out of line with the experience. Nice wine selection, too, by the glass and bottle, also at affordable prices. We highly recommend!
